Central Package Management

FeedItems.Title: Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

FeedItems.Title: Add a README to Your NuGet Package
FeedItems.Summary:
Today, we're excited to announce that you can pack a `README.md` file in your NuGet package and have it fully rendered on NuGet.org!

FeedItems.Title: .NET 5 NuGet Restore Failures on Linux distributions using NSS or ca-certificates
FeedItems.Summary: We will be releasing updated builds of NuGet this week to accommodate NuGet restore failures on Linux distributions. The failures are observed when updated versions of the NSS or ca-certificates...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Sign in comes back with "Error 500 - Internal Server Error"" (#9126) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

After trying to sign in from the browser, the page goes to Error 500 - Internal Server Error
I have tried to 
- Clear cache
- Restart
- Try from another computer
- Try from a different browser

All of these attempts failed and navigates to Error 500 - Internal Server Error
I have confirmed that the user password is working as I tried with Microsoft Account and the same account is able to login other Microsoft services

### Repro Steps

Login to nuget.org

### Expected Behavior

Successfully able to log in and use the service

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10838987/170829497-dfecdaf3-b7c7-4122-bdd7-d284e967bc02.png)


### Additional Context and logs

With a full network log, I can share the username if required
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10838987/170829560-2b6ee0ba-2bf2-4cdf-be0b-b993c786475d.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: 500 Server internal error when trying to login" (#9127) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

500 Server internal error when trying to login or to publish. Publish key should be valid and also the account.
I also created a new account just to be sure and same thing is happening. I used Edge and Firefox (also in private mode)
So this is happening with two separate accounts. One is older and the other is just created. 
Initially when the new account was created I was logged in but after sign out I just received Error 500 from Nuget.org (https://www.nuget.org/users/account/authenticate/return?ReturnUrl=%2F)
This is has been happening now for about couple of hours at least. Yesterday all worked just fine.
My ms accounts are working ok to other services (like Azure etc).

### Repro Steps

1. open https://www.nuget.org/
2. press Sign in
3. Select Sign in with Microsoft
4. Enter your credential and Sign in

### Expected Behavior

Expected to login normally nuget.org

### Screenshots

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97743379/170830776-88cb002c-aa9e-4953-a30e-d77b61690fe5.png)


### Additional Context and logs

I also get 500 server error when trying to publish new packet version via nuget push to my account

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Add indexing status to the status page" (#9125) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

Other/NA

### The Elevator Pitch

Indexing has taken over an hour for a package I've published.  Please add indexing status to the status page on nuget.org

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Details about Problem When uploading a package to nuget.org manually via the website, I can set a documentation URL that points to a readme file on github, as shown here: https://www.nuget.org/packages/blazor-server-githubactions-demo/  How do I this via a .csproject file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. how publish readme file automatically along with pacakge." (#9124) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

[NuGet.org Bug]: Details about Problem When uploading a package to nuget.org manually via the website, I can set a documentation URL that points to a readme file on github,


 as shown here: https://www.nuget.org/packages/blazor-server-githubactions-demo/  

How do I this via a .csproject file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. how publish readme file automatically along with pacakge.

### Repro Steps

https://www.nuget.org/packages/blazor-server-githubactions-demo/ 

### Expected Behavior

How do I this via a .csproject file, as I use CI / CD to publish my packages and so I don't want this to be a manual step. how publish readme file automatically along with pacakge.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Specifying both -f ... and -r ... to dotnet build fails to restore if multiple frameworks are present in the project file" (#11653) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Original bug: https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/21877

Repro:

```shell
$ dotnet new maui
$ dotnet build -f:net6.0-ios -r ios-arm64
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 17.0.0-preview-21477-04+3a1e456fe for .NET
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

  Determining projects to restore...
/usr/local/share/dotnet/packs/Microsoft.MacCatalyst.Sdk/15.0.101-preview.10.54/targets/Xamarin.Shared.Sdk.targets(1138,3): error : The RuntimeIdentifier 'ios-arm64' is invalid. [/Users/rolf/test/dotnet/maui/maui.csproj]
```

The problem is that it's trying to restore the `net6.0-maccatalyst` framework from the project file using the `ios-arm64` RuntimeIdentifier, which fails, because `ios-arm64` is not a valid RuntimeIdentifier for Mac Catalyst.

It seems that the implicit restore by "dotnet build" does not take into account the specified -f value (or takes into account the -r value when it shouldn't).

Binlog: [msbuild.binlog.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/files/7309029/msbuild.binlog.zip)

### Further technical details

<details><summary>dotnet --info</summary>

```
$ dotnet --info
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: [Bug Bash] The ‚ÄúVersion‚Äù dropdown box is blank in ‚ÄúConsolidate‚Äù tab of solution-level PM UI" (#11806) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.51

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

### Details about Problem
VS Version: Main\32509.107
NuGet Version: Dev\6.3.0.51
OS Version: Windows-11-Enterprise-21H2

### Repro steps:
1.Create a solution with two C# Console App (.NET Framework 4.8) projects in VS.
2.Right-Click the solution in the Solution Explorer and select the ‚ÄúMange NuGet Packages for Solution‚Äù.
3.Go to ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab, select a package (e.g. Newtonsoft.Json) and install different versions (with PackageReference format) into the different projects. (e.g. install 12.0.1 into the first project, install 12.0.2 into the second project)
4.Click the ‚ÄúConsolidate‚Äù tab, click the package ‚ÄúNewtonsoft.Json‚Äù in the list and observe the ‚ÄúVersion‚Äù dropdown box.

### Expected:
The ‚ÄúVersion‚Äù dropdown box is showing the latest installed version (12.0.2 in this instance), the version in the drowdown list can be reselected and the "Install" button is available.

### Actual:
The ‚ÄúVersion‚Äù dropdown box is blank, the version in the drowdown list cannot be reselected and the "Install" button is not available as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/167605435-14c7b265-c080-4976-bea9-a5117312a08a.png)

### Notes:
1. This issue starts to repro on Dev\6.3.0.10, does not repro on Dev\6.3.0.9.
2. It does not repro on .NET SDK style solution.
3. It does not repro when the package is installed with ‚Äúpackages.config‚Äù format in step3.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: The Latest Stable version does not show in the "Version" dropdown box after installing a package with not the latest version in ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab" (#11802) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

Dev\6.3.0.51

### Worked before?

Dev\6.3.0.15

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

## Repro steps:  
1. Create a C# Console App (.NET core) project via VS.
2. Open PM UI of the project by right clicking the project->Manage NuGet Packages‚Ä¶ in Solution Explorer.
3. Install a package (e.g. Newtonsoft.json) into the project with not the latest version in ‚ÄúBrowse‚Äù tab.
4. Switch to the ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù tab and observe the ‚Äúversion‚Äù dropdown box.
## Expected:
The Latest Stable version should show in the "Version" dropdown box in ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/167382210-fb22f501-d939-4b55-b829-c0cef045cc9a.png)
## Actual: 
The installed version shows in the "Version" dropdown box in ‚ÄúUpdates‚Äù tab as below screenshot. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71433406/167382264-80ea98ca-f41e-42c0-85bb-51aa1724324a.png)
## Note:
1. This issue starts to repro on Dev\6.3.0.17.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: PM UI version list only shows a single latest version" (#11734) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

17.2.0 Preview 3.0 [32407.349.d17.2] 

### Worked before?

Yes, works in 17.1.1 and 17.3.0 preview 1.0

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Open PM UI for a .net project
1. Switch to Browse tab
1. Ensure NuGet.org is the selected source
1. Search for `azure.resourcemanager`
1. Observe the version list menu

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/162587120-48259e2f-33a6-46fa-95eb-473e7556afc9.png)

It should show many versions, not just one.

I was unable to use "Report an issue" in VS because that option made VS lock up. I'm not sure how to report that.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Allow specifying a package source for a PackageReference in the csproj" (#11837) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Say your company has a nuget package on their private nuget repository called `VeryGood.Package`, and an unrelated package also exists by the same name on nuget.org. This is not a problem when working on the project locally in visual studio, because the Nuget Package Manager tab will show both when you search and you can just click the one provided by your company.

However, when building the project via the dotnet CLI, this creates a problem. If the csproj contains the following package reference
```yml
<PackageReference Include="VeryGood.Package" Version="1.1.0" />
```
this is ambiguous between the one on nuget.org and the private repository. This is problematic for automated builds in Azure Devops for an example.

I propose a `Source` option be added to `PackageReference` to determine where the package should come from.

Example PackageReference:
```yml
<PackageReference Include="VeryGood.Package" Version="1.1.0" Source="PrivateNuget"/>
```

Example nuget.config:
```yml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <clear />
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
    <add key="PrivateNuget" value="https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/TheVeryGoodCompany/_packaging/TheVeryGoodCompanyNuget/nuget/v3/index.json" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Allow specifying a package source for a PackageReference in the csproj" (#11837) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Say your company has a nuget package on their private nuget repository called `VeryGood.Package`, and an unrelated package also exists by the same name on nuget.org. This is not a problem when working on the project locally in visual studio, because the Nuget Package Manager tab will show both when you search and you can just click the one provided by your company.

However, when building the project via the dotnet CLI, this creates a problem. If the csproj contains the following package reference
```yml
<PackageReference Include="VeryGood.Package" Version="1.1.0" />
```
this is ambiguous between the one on nuget.org and the private repository. This is problematic for automated builds in Azure Devops for an example.

I propose a `Source` option be added to `PackageReference` to determine where the package should come from.

Example PackageReference:
```yml
<PackageReference Include="VeryGood.Package" Version="1.1.0" Source="PrivateNuget"/>
```

Example nuget.config:
```yml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <clear />
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" />
    <add key="PrivateNuget" value="https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/TheVeryGoodCompany/_packaging/TheVeryGoodCompanyNuget/nuget/v3/index.json" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: `dotnet add "x.csproj" package y` adds NuGet package instead of updating existing `<PackageReference>`" (#11792) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

6.0.202

### Worked before?

Don't know

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Moved from https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/25209

### Describe the bug
`dotnet add "your.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging` command does not update `<PackageReference><Version></Version></PackageReference>` template:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905878/166697188-755190a6-a5eb-4675-861f-7d278c8dab57.png)

But `dotnet remove "your.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging` works with both templates:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905878/166697574-2f548167-c48b-44ef-9887-76b38fd5c4fa.png)

It also doesn't update NuGet packages for "new" template. See https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/25209#issuecomment-1117613201
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/905878/166819341-65dc60f0-4a10-4a28-9866-60409650af98.png)

### To Reproduce

1. Your `csproj` file must contain this:
```
<PackageReference Include="SimpleInjector.Packaging">
  <Version>4.10.2</Version>
</PackageReference>
```
2. Run `dotnet add "your.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging`

<!--
We ‚ù§ code! Point us to a minimalistic repro project hosted in a GitHub repo, Gist snippet, or other means to see the isolated behavior.

We may close this issue if:
- the repro project you share with us is complex. We can't investigate custom projects, so don't point us to such, please.
- if we will not be able to repro the behavior you're reporting
-->

### Further technical details
- Include the output of `dotnet --info`:
```
Zestaw .NET SDK (odzwierciedlenie dowolnego pliku global.json):
 Version:   6.0.202
 Commit:    f8a55617d2

Srodowisko uruchomieniowe:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.19043
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\6.0.202\

Host (useful for support):
  Version: 6.0.4
  Commit:  be98e88c76
```
- The IDE (VS / VS Code/ VS4Mac) you're running on, and its version: **CLI**

### Verbose Logs

There is no `--verbosity` option for `dotnet add package`...

Here is standard output:

Running command first time (with deleted `bin` and `obj` folders):
```shell
dotnet add "bbb.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging
  Trwa okreslanie projekt√≥w do przywr√≥cenia...
  Writing C:\Users\Adam\AppData\Local\Temp\tmp8AB8.tmp
info : Dodawanie elementu PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" do projektu ,bbb.csproj".
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/index.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/1.4.2.12140/3.1.2.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/3.1.3/4.8.0-alpha1.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/4.8.0-alpha2/5.0.0.json
info : Trwa przywracanie pakiet√≥w dla elementu C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj...
info : Pakiet ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" jest zgodny ze wszystkimi strukturami okreslonymi w projekcie ,bbb.csproj".
info : Element PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" w wersji ,5.0.0" zostal dodany do pliku ,C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj".
info : Generowanie pliku programu MSBuild C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\bbb.csproj.nuget.g.props.
info : Generowanie pliku programu MSBuild C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\bbb.csproj.nuget.g.targets.
info : Zapisywanie pliku zasob√≥w na dysk. Sciezka: C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\project.assets.json
log  : Przywr√≥cono element C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj (w 314 ms).
```

Running second time:
```shell
dotnet add "bbb.csproj" package SimpleInjector.Packaging
  Trwa okreslanie projekt√≥w do przywr√≥cenia...
  Writing C:\Users\Adam\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpBD1E.tmp
info : Dodawanie elementu PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" do projektu ,bbb.csproj".
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/index.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/1.4.2.12140/3.1.2.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/3.1.3/4.8.0-alpha1.json
info :   CACHE https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/simpleinjector.packaging/page/4.8.0-alpha2/5.0.0.json
info : Trwa przywracanie pakiet√≥w dla elementu C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj...
info : Pakiet ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" jest zgodny ze wszystkimi strukturami okreslonymi w projekcie ,bbb.csproj".
info : Element PackageReference dla pakietu ,SimpleInjector.Packaging" w wersji ,5.0.0" zostal dodany do pliku ,C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj".
info : Plik zasob√≥w nie ulegl zmianie. Zapisywanie pliku zasob√≥w jest pomijane. Sciezka: C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\obj\project.assets.json
log  : Przywr√≥cono element C:\xxx\yyy\Source\Client\Client-Addons\bbb\bbb.csproj (w 133 ms).
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: NOTICE.TXT includes Lucene references" (#11804) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

dotnet --info .NET SDK (reflecting any global.json):  Version:   6.0.104  Commit:    915d644e45

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Hi,

I'm writing here as I'm packaging dotnet suite for Ubuntu from source build, and we are finding some 3rd party software issues, one of them related to the Nuget.client as you can read here https://github.com/dotnet/source-build/issues/2147#issuecomment-1121310464.

The file https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/0471d9e44848c4d00e37f2f7d4e9a1b69eb0b213/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.VisualStudio.Client/NOTICES.txt is propagated to the dotnet suite tarball source (it was built using MSBuild) through the processes carried out by the installer and the source build repos (it creates a /src/nuget-client.* folder), but looking at the software build and also the source code, the references to Lucene are no longer present (src/Lucene.Net/\*) ... could it be not up-to-date? Could you check it, please?

Thanks in advance. Kind regards,

Miriam


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Package Status Indicators in Visual Studio." (#11838) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Introduction to an experience in Visual Studio in which a developer can view the current package statuses in the solution explorer.

This proposal introduces a concept of package status indicators in Visual Studio.

[Rendered Spec]()

Please üëç or üëé this comment to help us with the direction of this feature & leave as much feedback/questions/concerns as you'd like on this issue itself and we will get back to you shortly.

Thank You üéâ
